data.title: Adult Learning @ the Public Library
data.meta_description: LibGuides: Adult Learning @ the Public Library: Computer Classes and One-on-One Support
data.text:
Ongoing Computer Classes

and One-on-One Support

Call your local branch to make an appointment to accommodate your schedule. Most classes require advance registration.

Alamosa:

One-on-One. Call 836-0684 to schedule an appointment.

Topics available:

Internet searching and browsing

Creating and using an email account

Getting started with MS Word

Creating a resume

Cherry Hills:

Digital Basics: One on One. Tuesdays, 1pm. Learn the basics of Microsoft Word, how to create and use an email account, or how to use library resources. Classes are taught either on a library computer or the patron’s tablet (i.e. Kindle or iPad). For computer basics, patron must have a library card in good standing with computer access. For tablet basics, patron must bring their device and its passwords as well as library card and PIN. Registration is required and limited to 1. Call 857-8321 to register, or click the Register link in the event listing on the Cherry Hills event calendar.

Erna Fergusson:

Digital Basics: One on One. Wednesdays, 3pm - 5pm and Fridays 1pm - 2pm. We can help with library digital materials, email, device troubleshooting, and more. Sign up for a One on One half-hour session with a staff member to help with your tech related woes. For help with personal devices, bring device and related passwords. For general computer help, a library card in good standing and a PIN are required. Make an appointment at the Erna Fergusson Information Desk or call us at (505)888-8100..

International District:

One-On-One: Get one-on-one help with your tech questions. Assistance with basic computer navigation, establishing email, job applications, resume design, and library resources. Help is available with your personal device or on one of our public computers. All participants must have a valid library card prior to appointment. Please call 768-4970 or visit the International District library to reserve a spot. Appointments available Wednesdays and Thursdays.

Lomas Tramway:

Computer and Mobile Device Help in English and Spanish. Various times by appointment only. Get one-on-one help downloading and using our e-books and e-resources with your device or computer. We’ll also help with basic computer navigation, email, and creating word documents on your computer or ours. All participants must have a valid library card prior to appointment. Please call 291-6295 or visit the Lomas Tramway library to make an appointment.

Ayuda técnica con las computadoras o los aparatos móviles está disponible en español. Llámenos al 291-6295 o pregunte en el mostrador sobre cómo hacer una cita. Los participantes deben tener una tarjeta de biblioteca en regla.

Los Griegos:

One-on-One, Bilingual English and Spanish. Every Friday of the month at 12 noon and by appointment. One-on-one help with online email software, MS Office including Word, Excel, and Publisher, as well as downloadable resources and apps available with your device or computer. Must have a library card in good standing. Please call 761-4020 or visit the Los Griegos branch to make an appointment.

Rudolfo Anaya North Valley:

One-on-One. E-reader & Computer Help. Saturdays, 10 am to 11 am. Registration is required, call 897-8823 to schedule an appointment. Participants must have a library card in good standing.

South Broadway:

One-on-One Device Training. Second Thursday of the month, 4 – 5 p.m. A one-on-one help session for those needing technical support with eBooks, eAudiobooks, and other digital media. Bring your device/laptop. Registration is required. Participants must have a library card in good standing. Call 764-1742 to schedule an appointment.

South Valley:

One-on-One, Bilingual English and Spanish. Saturdays at 10 a.m. Must have a valid library ard. Ages 13+. Call 877-5170 to schedule an appointment.
